bibl.title: John Bowler and Edward McCrinkle v. James H. Bennett. Complaint, Exhibit C
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court for the Third Judicial District of Washington

body.p: COMPLAINT Before C.D. EMERY, United States Commissioner, Seattle, Wash. No.103
United States of America, Territory of Washington, } ss. City of Seattle
John Bowler of Seattle in the County of King and Territory of Washington, being duly sworn, deposes and says that James H. Bennett

heretofore, to-wit, on the 15 day of June A.D. 1888 ----- upon the high seas with then admiralty jurisdiction of the United States and out of the jurisdiction of any particular state being then and there master of the steam-ship Alki, the siad steamship being then and there owned by citizens of the United States, in and on board of said steamship Alki, with a dangerous weapon, towit, with brass knuckles in and upon the person of the said deponen did make an assault and him the said deponent did then and there bear wound and illtreat.

And deponent on oath further says that on the same day and year upon the high seas and on waters within the admiralty and maritimejurisdiction of the United States upon the said American steamship Alki of which steam ship he the said James H. Bennett was then adn there master he the said James H. Bennett from malice and hatred and without justifiable cause did and would the said John Bowler, this deponent, he the said deponent being then adn there a seaman duly shipped on board of and in the employ of said steamship

contrary to the form of the statute in such case made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the United States of America. Wherefore the said deponent prays that the said James H. Bennett may be apprehended and dealth with according to law. And, furthermore, the said deponent prays that William Davis, Edward McCrink, Fred Swanson, Antonio Fernando + Charles James whom he has reason to believe, and does believe, are material witnesses to the subject matter of this Complaint, may be duly summoned to appear and give testimony thereto.
(Signature) John Bowler Sworn to and subscribed before me this 20 day of June A.D. 1888 C.D. Emery U.S. Commissioner
